website_summaries.verdict: Choose them if you prefer cool light and like the idea of the five-year hassle-free warranty.
pros: Instant bright light with a cool glow
Long life backed by a five-year warranty
cons: Doesn't work well with some dimmer switches, including Lutron models
Some users report a buzzing noise that is quite loud

website_summaries.verdict: These bulbs have a low failure rate. Their performance is comparable to that of high-end Philips bulbs.
pros: Works well in recessed lighting fixtures and outdoor applications
Durable plastic housing is safer than glass
cons: Bulbs can grow hot without good ventilation
An additional dimmer switch may be needed to eliminate buzzing

customer_reviews.title: Nice color but tooo slooooow
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the high CRI and because I liked the Hyperikon replacements for my fluorescent tubes. The color is good and they are plenty bright, but compared to my Cree and Philips LED bulbs these have a very long delay before turning on. I'd planned to add these fixtures with my existing "faster" bulbs to improve the overall color, but these are just too slow to turn on. the fixtures light up in two steps. It's annoying I'll have to find another use for these. The large base also casts a shadow toward the socket, unlike my 80 CRI Cree bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: R B

customer_reviews.title: Hyperikon's customer service is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I originally had bad flickering problems with these bulbs, but Hyperikon contacted me and sent a new set of bulbs with a different dimmer switch to try. Different brands seem to work better with different dimmers, even if they're all specified for CFL/LED bulbs. They were very helpful in working with me, and they refused to give up until I had a bulb/dimmer combo that worked and that I was happy with. That's far more than I can say for most companies, especially a light bulb company. I would definitely recommend them on that fact alone, but if you get dimmable bulbs just make sure you have one of their specified dimmers and you probably won't have any issues anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Fulgham

customer_reviews.title: Delayed turn on
customer_reviews.text: There is a slight delay when turning on these bulbs. It is small but enough that it annoys me every time I flip the light switch. Used in a room with other bulbs hooked to the same switch, the other led bulbs turn on immediately and these hyperikon lat behind. It's like the room lights up in two stages. The color rendering seems good and pleasant. However the bulbs have a dark spot directly across from the screw in base. This is not a defect in a single bulb but rather the design of the bulb.
customer_reviews.author: df

customer_reviews.title: Going full LED at home
customer_reviews.text: We are going all LED at home and these are my favorite bulbs. Nice bright warm white. I have bought 3 boxes of these. If you have a compatible dimmer switch such as Lutron Maestro 150 watt multi-location cfl/led digital dimmer, you will never have any flicker in your ceiling fixtures. These work in our recesses cans and table lamps. For table lamps, we bought Leviton TBL03 10 watt tabletop slide control 300 watt dimmer. I mounted the dimmer to the back side of our buffet w/ 3M foam mounting tape. Works great and is out of sight. The above dimmers also purchased on Amazon. I did a lot of research tp get the right products.
customer_reviews.author: dooie55

customer_reviews.title: Small and Natural
customer_reviews.text: These seem top notch, so far. They dim smoothly and quietly. They are significantly smaller than my previous LED bulbs of equivalent lumens (Phillips). And they seem fine in terms of wavelength and natural tone. One warning: they don't dim as low as the Phillips bulbs (at least with my old analogue dimmers), so that's an issue if you want them to go way down. I'd say they go down to about 30%, nowhere near the 10% that some other LEDS go to (even with old dimmers). I don't need that dimming, so I'm not knocking off a star, but you might knock off two or three if that matters to you.
customer_reviews.author: Franz Metcalf

customer_reviews.title: One (now two) flickered-was replaced by company
customer_reviews.text: 3/4 worked great. The fourth one flickers like a bad fluorescent light. Edit: I added back one star since the company reached out and replaced the faulty light free of charge. Edit 2: Just had one more (out of a batch of 8) start flickering on me. Not worth the warranty hassle so I bought some of the HyperSelects to replace them all. I've only had flickering happen on the dimmable hyperikons, the cheaper hyperselects have always worked well. They are lower CRI but I don't notice the difference and are less of a headache to deal with so I will probably stick with those.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Bad at dimming
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs do not dim well at all. I have tried several kinds of dimmable LED bulb on various dimmers, and these bulbs cause a very loud buzzing sound and do not dim smoothly. They do claim to work properly with their verified list of dimmers, but unfortunately none of my dimmers are on their list. Normally I would let this go, as they do clearly state that they only work with specific dimmers. However, because the compatibility of these bulbs are so poor in comparison to others I have used, I have to take some stars off. Aside from that, the color temp and brightness are very good, and they have no problems if left on their max brightness.
customer_reviews.author: David Esposito

customer_reviews.title: There is a noticeable delay when turning these on.
customer_reviews.text: I normally use Philips LEDs, but decided to try this brand because they offer a 4000 Kelvin option (Philips does not). The light output is nice on this bulb. However, there is a half second delay when turning it on. When you are used to having instant-on bulbs, the delay on these becomes quite noticeable and annoying. Unfortunately, I’ll be taking these out of my bathroom and installing them in a guest bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Go Blue 99

customer_reviews.title: Good for me, others take note
customer_reviews.text: I gave these a 5 star, but maybe I should have given them a 4... Not sure. For me, these are 5 star. They are the right color, work great, and dim well. Also, great price especially with prime free shipping. It does everything it says it does. For others, I could see this being a 3-4 star. They DO buzz - faintly, yet audible. Also, the description says dim to 20%. My incandescents dim much lower than this, so it looks odd on my chandelier at lowest setting. I am getting a new light fixture, so I decided to order all new bulbs from Amazon for it, so this shouldn't be an issue. But for others, it might.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan G.

customer_reviews.title: Problem Solver
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace hard-to-reach fixtures. I am female over 65 and 5 foot nothing, so it is an ordeal for me when my kitchen ceiling lights go out. I have replaced all my "tall" lights except one (the handyman will have to get that one) with these bulbs. The customer reviews were really helpful and I especially appreciated the customer who sent pictures showing the comparison of different bulbs. Have decided that the 3000K is best for my general needs, not too yellow and not too harsh. If you have elderly parents or grandparents, do them a favor and replace some of their old obsolete bulbs with these. They will thank you for it!
customer_reviews.author: W. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Nice light quality, but they make a hum when dimmed
customer_reviews.text: Nice light quality, but they make a hum when dimmed. I was using a Lutron Toggler C.L Dimmer Switch, which specifically listed LEDs. Replaced them with Philips bulbs and no issues - and put these into non-dimmed sockets where they work fine. IMOm there's no point paying extra for 'dimmable' bulbs when they make noise when dimmed. I have some dimmable Hyperikon 60W floods - and they're fine (dim fine / no noise). Maybe I got a bad batch?
customer_reviews.author: Bob KoureTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: They buzzzzzzzzz and one already burned out
customer_reviews.text: I installed 4 of these in my living room ceiling fan, another 5 in my dinning room and another 4 in my bed room ceiling fan. I got these specifically because they are dimmable. These bulbs are disappointing, they do a low buzzing noise in both my living room and bed room and a slightly louder buzzing noise in my dinning room. They do however dim just fine, but the buzzing noise is annoying. Update: Had to lowering the rating to one star because I've had these light bulbs now for exactly 13 days of use now. I bought 12 of them and one of them just wet out. Don't have faith that the rest will last long.
customer_reviews.author: _.EfraiN._

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these bulbs a few days, so I cannot comment on their lifespan. However, I love that they are small and very aesthetically pleasing to look at. The color of the light is soft and they do not make the room look like a hospital. My favorite thing about these lights is that they dim to a much lower light output than the other dimmable bulbs I have installed in the same fixture. Those bulbs will just turn off at about 50% dim and the Hyperikon bulbs will keep getting dimmer. They allow us to keep the lights really low for movies, without having to sit in pitch dark.
customer_reviews.author: Seth Chapman

customer_reviews.title: VERY Pleased With This Purchase
customer_reviews.text: So glad to have found these dimmable, 3000 Kelvin LED bulbs. I realize that color perception is a personal thing, and it's no surprise that the buying public apparently has 'spoken' to the LED bulb manufacturers regarding their preference for LED bulbs with a golden yellow (2700 Kelvin) appearance. But I prefer lights with a more accurate color , particularly important when the LED is 'dimmed.' These bulbs are being utilized in wall sconces that we frequently set at less than full brightness (e.g. low room lighting for watching TV at night), and we're much happier with their more natural color while dimmed.
customer_reviews.author: EspressoGuy

customer_reviews.title: 3000k Paves the way and brightened our day!
customer_reviews.text: These are really great lights and well worth the money! I purchased the 3000k soft glow for our 4 recessed canisters in our kitchen. My wife was very pleased with the color contrast and made big improvements in the overall brightness compared to what was previously there. As a test, I also installed 2 of these bulbs in our bedroom which had dimmer switches. Again, was pleasantly surprised with the dimming quality and didn't have that white noise typically associated with LED dimmable bulbs. Kudo's on a great product! Will update if any issues arise with longevity of these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: QATesterDan

customer_reviews.title: No issues, just good lights
customer_reviews.text: These work perfectly. Even with a Caseta dimmer (we hooked them up in a test installation) even though they're not on the very small approved list. I've been impressed with Hyperikon products in general (we've used several variants of their bulbs with no issues). And when I had some questions their customer service person on the phone was very responsive. Only nit is that Amazon doesn't offer all their products (specifically color temperature choices). But that's not Hyperikon's fault. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LoneJohnny5

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are very clean looking, almost like the old fashioned incandescents. The only difference being the solid plastic base near the bottom (they have to have somewhere to put the electronics). The color rendering is "spot on" and the light is nicely diffused. It's actually a bit more subtle than the old frosted incandescent bulbs. They give off a nice crisp but warm white light. Not as yellow as the 2700K LED's I have been replacing all my halogen and "curly fry" CFL's with LED bulbs. I am 70YO and figure these will probably outlive me; at least that's the plan!! I am very pleased with my choice and it was based on other Amazon Reviews!!
customer_reviews.author: Gaart Skarsgård

customer_reviews.title: Nice!!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good!!! I will post again at a later date to see how long they last and anything else that may apply to this item. Update: I'm using these in a mini theater in my home, and the color temperature is perfect!!! The warm amber glow is gentle on the eyes and actually improves the color palette rendering flesh tones of people (bulbs are also used in the living room where I entertain) enhanced and well..looking very good. If you're looking for more of an warmer glow, this is the bulb for you. If you're looking for something less warm or off white, then try the 2700K bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: What's the buzz on these lights? Humm?
customer_reviews.text: I suppose you have to pick the lesser of evils when looking for high lumen LEDs. These definitely buzz / hum with the Leviton 6674-P0W dimmer switch for my island pendant lights, but they at least don't interfere with my FM kitchen radio like my Torchstar can lights, yet they don't buzz. It would probably be less noticeable if it wasn't close to ear level as pendants. Edit: To clarify, the buzz is only noticeable for me within a couple feet and by no means is it unbearable, but it would be nice if they didn't do it at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Buzzing is WAY TOO LOUD!
customer_reviews.text: I like that these bulbs are dimmable and save energy, but they buzz so loudly at most dim levels that I have uninstalled them and replaced them with incandescent bulbs. It drove me NUTS how loud they are!! Whether a lamp on an end table or a pendant above the kitchen island, the sound was overly distracting. These bulbs may be decent for an outdoor light that you want to keep on all night, but definitely not indoors in my opinion unless it is far away from people.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great LED Bulbs for Right LED Dimmer
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs work great on Lutron Skylark dimmer switch SCL-153PH, which works with dimmable LED and CFL bulbs. It's possible many of the reviews that mention bulbs "buzzing" are on an old dimmer or one made for incandescent/halogen bulbs like the Lutron Skylark S-600PR. I kind of learned this the hard way. If you are stuck with an older dimmer switch like I was or one like the Lutron Skylark S-600PR, I found that the Cree SA19-08127MDFD-12DE26-1-14 LED bulbs work fine with this switch with no "buzzing."
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: More light on the vanity top for fraction of the energy versus incandescent.
customer_reviews.text: This was our 1st use of a 60w led. Replaced burned out incandescent 60w in bathroom fixture along with the 3 others that likely had limited life left. The LEDs looked and sized and installed exactly like the 60w incandescent. The light seemed significantly brighter than the old bulbs. I think more light was directed downward on the vanity top. Also the color was slightly whiter/non-yellowish perhaps a factor in seeming brighter. 36w versus 240w for more light on the table top is impressive. Lights are not on a dimmer, and they were instant on with the switch and no flickering. Now hope they stay reliable In the years ahead.
customer_reviews.author: RRWA

customer_reviews.title: Noticeable delay in turn-on time.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 14 of the 3000K/820-lumen bulbs. Despite the product stats listing a "Start Up Time" of "Instant-On", 12 of the bulbs exhibited a dramatic delay in turn-on. It was long enough that I immediately noticed despite that fact that I was not at all looking for this problem - I didn't even know this could happen. The delay varies slightly, but I'd say it gets up near a quarter second, or the amount of time it takes for an object dropped from about a foot up to hit the floor. I also bought a handful of bulbs in 3000K/470-lumen and 5000K/860-lumen, but none of those exhibited a delay.
customer_reviews.author: dbplunkett

customer_reviews.title: Great light color and brightness, but dimming isn't quite silent
customer_reviews.text: I'm please with the 3000K color temperature of these LED bulbs. They're slightly cooler in color than a incandescent warm white bulb, which typically is around 2700K, but without skewing into the too-blue spectrum. They do dim smoothly, using the built-in dimmers on ourlamps. Unfortunately, all four of the bulbs do hum/buzz when dimmed -- three of them I'd say are barely audible but one is distinctly noisy enough to notice. We're using these in our bedside lamps, so the buzzing can be a bit distracting when one person is reading and another person is trying to sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for my chandeliers!!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced the incandescent bulbs in my dining room & breakfast nook chandeliers with these LED bulbs (4 in each), and they work perfectly (just the right amount of light (60 watts equivalent for each bulb, but each using only 9 watts of electricity!), and the dimming is excellent (much smoother than the CFL bulbs that I've tried before).... And they look great as well (perfect color temperature (soft white), and not too harsh a light.... Would definitely buy these again! :)
customer_reviews.author: Semi-retired in LA

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased a house with dimmers in every room, all incandescent. I was worried these would not work as others have stated you need special dimmers in order for perfect function. So I purchased with the expectation of returning them. However, after using them quite the contrary. I love them, they dim down to an acceptable dimness. The savings in the electric bill I look forward too, plus the less in cooling costs will be great. I am no longer cringing when I turn on a light switch, feels great!
customer_reviews.author: Reaching New Heights

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: These turn on at full brightness -- brighter and more omnidirectional than I expected. They generate so little heat that you can grab and hold the bulb or the metal fixture without fear. They cost almost nothing to operate. I immediately ordered more, and I'm getting rid of all my other bulbs! I can't speak about longevity, nor have I used a dimmer, and color temperature preferences are a bit personal, but for me, these rock!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: I really like this 3000K color I got
customer_reviews.text: They work and none of them have burned out yet. I really like this 3000K color I got, it feels even easier on the eyes than normal incandescent bulbs. I should mention that they don't appear to have the hardcore exposed, heavy, and finned heatsinks you might find in some more expensive LED's, especially older Cree ones, but it does look very clean, smooth, and would fit in most homes no problem. I don't know if that means worse longevity, you'd have to ask an engineer, or maybe wait and compare after years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Garlond

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell in use
customer_reviews.text: After a great experience with Hyperikon's 100W bulbs, I bought this set of 60W for another fixture. Color temperature is the same and light output is excellent, but within a short time, I noticed an awful burning smell. All four bulbs gave off this smell. I tried another fixture and running them for a few hours to no effect. They're going back to Amazon. With a sample size of one, I can't say if this is typical, but it was disconcerting. Feit Electric's 3000K 60W equivalent LEDs blend well with my 100W Hyperikons and have no smell.
customer_reviews.author: D. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Sounded like a good idea
customer_reviews.text: I've recently purchased LED bulbs for my entire house to reduce the electric. Sounded like a good idea. Reduced my electric bill greatly. Almost can't believe, I'm in the middle of winter, and my electric bill is less now then it was in the summer. I had my doubts about LED lights, if they would give a warm light, that looked natural. I have to say I'm wrong. Bulbs have improved greatly. I found them to be brighter then a 40 or 60 watt bulb and at a 1/4 of the energy used. All good!! Save $$ and I can still see!! Don't hesitate to try!
customer_reviews.author: sarah smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Light, Bright,Compact and Efficient.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy I got these. The first thing I noticed is they're smaller, more compact than another brand of LED 60w equivalent bulbs I own - more similar to a traditional incandescent. I tested them side by side in a kitchen light fixture and noticed they did not dim as low as the other brand but since these are not destined for a dimmable lamp, that doesn't bother me. What I do like is the quality of the light. At 3000k, it's bright but not overly yellow or blue. Colors in the room appear more vivid. It's also good to know Hyperikon has great customer service and stands behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Smith

customer_reviews.title: Work great and do not buzz!
customer_reviews.text: We learned the hard way that there is a definite difference between cheap and more expensive LED bulbs! We replaced the LEDs in a ceiling light connected to a LED dimmable switch with these lightbulbs. They work great and DO NOT BUZZ! (Two of the four cheap LED bulbs also died after 8 months.) We will definitely be buying more of these as we switch out our old bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: D37

customer_reviews.title: 3000k 9w LED bulbs - Impressive bulbs.
customer_reviews.text: I had a chance to do some side by side comparisons with other LED bulbs that I have installed in my home. The color is what I would describe as halogen white and it is my preferred color temperature. The claimed high CRI appears to be correct as I immediately noticed an improvement in the appearance of colors when compared to some of the older LED bulbs I have. I’m impressed with them and will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: an Engineer

customer_reviews.title: High CRI is Everything!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because of the high CRI (Color Rendering Index) and the difference between these and bulbs I bought at the big box stores is phenomenal. I've always had incandescent lights in the Master Bathroom and decide to change them out to LED. Purchased 3k soft white bulbs from the big box store and everything had a strange look to it with a yellow tint. I ordered these bulbs and now I can live with LED bulbs! The light looks natural and normal.
customer_reviews.author: RH

customer_reviews.title: Love em. "Gee if these things really last 25 odd years I may never be changing this bulb ever again."
customer_reviews.text: Really nice purchase. They work fine and dim smoothly from Insteon dimmers. I would not recommend the 5000k white bulbs as they look like fluorescent tubes. I installed these outside. The warmer colored bulbs offer great light and more lumens than a 60w incandescent. As I was moving the ladder around the house replacing all the pot lamps, some of which had blown out I kept thinking "Gee if these things really last 25 odd years I may never be changing this bulb ever again."
customer_reviews.author: Mark B

customer_reviews.title: This is a great light bulb.I just learned about CRI (color rate index)..
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light bulb. Trust me, I have so many misc LED bulbs that I've tried over the years. I just now learned about CRI. Most LED bulbs are around 80-85 CRI (color rate index). Think of it this way, an old-school light bulb is hot, its real light. It has a 100 CRI. These bulbs have the best CRI I've seen at 95. However, the light could dim more. Like all LED's the light is a bit foggy when dimmed. Those are the downsides of using 90% less power to light these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Colby Neal

customer_reviews.title: at some middle "frequencies" the bulbs flicker
customer_reviews.text: at some middle "frequencies" the bulbs flicker The dimmer switch and the light are old so perhaps that is the problem? UPDATE: I updated my review from 3 stars to 5 stars. The problem was the very old dimmer switch. Once i replaced the dimmer switch with a modern one, the problem went away. Also, Hperikon's customer service people were very helpful and followed up to insure the issue was resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Racz

customer_reviews.title: Replacing all of my current bulbs with these!!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are amazing! Our bedroom is dark and no matter what I do, I can't seem to brighten up the room. I do not like the super bright daylight bulbs that give off a blue tint, yet the soft white bulbs always give off a yellow hint. I spent a ridiculous amount of time researching lumens, wattage, the kelvin scale and trying to find the perfect combination. These bulbs are perfect. They have no color cast and brighten up the whole room as if someone opened a bunch of windows. I absolutely love these and will be ordering them for all the light fixtures in my house.
customer_reviews.author: SweetestJamie

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant, great CRI, pleasing color - best I've found.
customer_reviews.text: I tried out many 60w replacement LED bulbs - nerded out about it. These were by far the best, Great CRI - the boxes that arrived say 95+ instead of 90+ and I think I believe it. The spectrum is warm with, if anything, a very slight/subtle pink cast which is pleasing to my eye, while making colors pop. Bright and outstanding. I ordered more for myself and am on a mission to help my friends and family replace their incandescents with these.
customer_reviews.author: Koufonissi

customer_reviews.title: Maybe if you wear headphones when the lights are dimmed...
customer_reviews.text: These light bulbs work perfectly as far as dimming and brightening goes. However, I rarely dim them as I would like to. The buzzing noise they make when dimmed is an annoyance, and detracts from any ambiance they create. It drives me nuts. They have lasted well, though, on normal brightness, and do not buzz at that level. They also have a nice soft glow.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: ... bought these light bulbs before and I was very satisfied, but this new round of four bulbs is ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these light bulbs before and I was very satisfied, but this new round of four bulbs is different. They have a Delayed Start-Up. The bulbs come on a second after the older bulbs (same Hyperikon A19 bulbs I bought earlier this year). They are in a multiple bulb fixture, and so it appears as a flicker every time I turn on the switch. I'm disappointed in what appears to be a misguided design change or poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Duder

customer_reviews.title: Good light, needs a bit more spread of light for me
customer_reviews.text: A good light but maybe not as much spread iof light as I was hoping. In an overhead light where the light is positioned horizontal, it really shines a lot out the end of this light. I replaced it with another brand for that reason. So for this application I'd rather have something with more rounded light from all sides. I think the bulb is good, just not exactly good for my application.
customer_reviews.author: NC

customer_reviews.title: Bought these for use with a GE 12724 Dimmer hoping ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for use with a GE 12724 Dimmer hoping, because the dimmer is rated for LEDs, that there'd be no buzzing. Unfortunately that's not the case. The buzzing is definitely more noticeable at different levels but at any level, I was able to hear the buzzing from the fan light sockets 5 above my head. Additionally, the 3000K Warm White Glow is insanely white and lacking in any sort of "glow." These are too blinding to be used indoors in my opinion. They'll be going in my outside light fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Dimmable with specific dimmers maybe.
customer_reviews.text: I have these in 3 outdoor fixtures they are all on independent daylight sensors when dusk arrives they all strobe which leads me to believe 1 of 2 things they are not dimmable as it states or they require a special led photosensor/dimmer to work properly. It is what it is to save power at this point. My house looks like a disco club for about 10 minutes every day until it's dark enough to come on all the way.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bautista

customer_reviews.title: Absolute BEST LED I have ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best LED light bulbs in my personal opinion. The soft white is so natural looking ! It is a very warm light perfect for the entire home. In fact I have replaced every single bulb in my home with one of these. Not only is the lighting more natural and warm looking, but my electric bill is low! I would highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: M125

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great bulb
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a great bulb. I use them in my kitchen with a dimable switch. I have not experienced the "buzzing noise" as I read in other reviews. Nice tone and brightness. I'd recommend at least trying them. The price is right. Updated: 1 year later the bulbs are beginning to flicker. Maybe not as good quality as I thought. I'm just using them as on/off bulbs now. Changed my rating from 5 to 3 as a result since these are supposed to be dimable.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Would like to covert to LED but need really low wattage ...
customer_reviews.text: I have an 18 light bar in my bathroom that currently has 25 watt bulbs. Would like to covert to LED but need really low wattage or they will be too bright. The bar is also on a dimmable switch and the bulbs are frosted round globes. Do you carry a bulb for that? I would be ecstatic. Can't find replacements anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: odie

customer_reviews.title: Will buzz with some dimmers
customer_reviews.text: For the most part these are great light bulbs. One star deducted because they buzz with certain dimmers, including some dimmers designed for LEDs: - Lutron Caseta plug-in lamp dimmer: unacceptable buzz and hum, not usable - Lutron Maestro C-L dimmer: very slight buzz, probably OK for most people - Lutron Caseta ELV dimmer: no sound at all, works very well So ideally I would recommend forward-phase ELV dimmers for these bulbs as they may buzz otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisd

customer_reviews.title: Decent bulbs they produce a great light. Make sure to use them on and ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent bulbs they produce a great light. Make sure to use them on and led dimmer, a dimmer for incandescent or halogen will not work. With an led dimmer they are about 95% flicker free which is why I deducted a star. The flicker isn't noticeable around the room but if you look at the light you will noticed that at the dimmest setting there's a slight flicker.
customer_reviews.author: M-Rod

customer_reviews.title: They provide a nice neutral white light
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of the 4 packs of these LEDs to replace all the old incandescent throughout my home as part of a remodel. The A19 size means they will screw into your regular-old light fixtures with ease. They provide a nice neutral white light, that is not the muddy yellow or stark blue of the other ends of the K spectrum. Also, the high CRI value makes colors look really good. I only have these LEDs on a dedicated light switch without a dimmer, so I can't speak to whether or not they buzz or flicker on dimmer switches. However, I haven't experienced any of the phone or radio interference that some have claimed to have run into.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Clark

customer_reviews.title: Emits pink light
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs make my white ceiling look pinkish, and they turn my blue sofa an ugly reddish blue. I tried to get used to them, but the pink makes the room seem dark and dreary. I had hoped these bulbs would brighten up our cave-like house without running up the electric bill, but the pink is possibly even worse than no extra light at all. I only bought four to start with, and I won't be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Violet

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT, and very high quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm in the process of replacing all of my lights with low energy LEDs. After lots of research and reading reviews, I decided to give Hyperikon a shot -- and I'm glad I did. The A19 bulb is BRIGHT, and probably paired best with a dimmer switch for that reason. So far, I've heard no buzzing and haven't had any of the 10+ bulbs fail. To top it off, each bulb is backed by a 5yr warranty, so no worries if something goes wrong. I've recommended these to all my friends and family and have yet to hear anything but praise. Stop looking, stop researching, and give these a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Unkulunkulu

customer_reviews.title: Bright and cooler than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very bright. They don't list the Color Rendering Index (CRI), but I'm guessing it's pretty low. I wasn't much of a fan of the quality of light. It's supposed to be fairly warm, but I found it cool. We've been on a search to find LED bulbs we like for 4 sconces in our living room, and did not find it with these. You can see the bulbs through the glass on these sconces, and the cool bright glare was too much. We're returning them. They are dimmable and they don't flicker (except for while you're actually sliding the dimmer). They also don't dim very far down - probably to about 50% and that's it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Brandenburg

customer_reviews.title: Great LED bulbs - don't look any further.
customer_reviews.text: This is the ultimate company for LED lighting. All the sizes available, spotlight and regular bulb. You can feel how robust these bulbs are built. Perfect specs for housings designed for this size. Nice wide angle, all working fine, and great price. Make sure you buy the right size for your required use. Great customer service email after purchase to offer free replacement and shipping in case of DOA, but all my bulbs worked FINE.
customer_reviews.author: P.G.

customer_reviews.title: Bulb DOA
customer_reviews.text: 1 of the 4 bulbs was DOA. When I've had issues like this with bulbs, the actual life of the working bulbs was about 10% of the claimed life, so I'm not holding my breath, but I wouldn't buy this brand again. On the low level of my two-level light switch, the bulbs flicker annoyingly. This did not improve with time. I moved them to a ceiling light with a dimmer switch, and the flicker there seems less.
customer_reviews.author: Drummer boy

customer_reviews.title: It does dim :)
customer_reviews.text: Saw some reviews saying light didn't dim so I went onto Hyperikon website and purchased a recommended dimmer switch Lutron s-600p wh 600 watt. No buzzing and dimes perfectly. Only complaint is on me, I was too focused on finding a LED that could dim that I forgot all about bulb colors. Soft white is more like bright white/blueish but the blue may come from the covers. Just installed so they might burn out in 5min or burn down the house but the product works as advertised so 5 stars for now. Glad we solved the problem of my 60w bulbs let's fix my 3500w airconditioner next.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Wesstphal III

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought several packs of these 2.5 years ago. 3 of 20 or so have failed. That is too high after 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.author: N. Mead

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a few regular buldbd and loved it. Bought a bunch more and replaced all ...
customer_reviews.text: Want to rate them higher. Bought a few. Replaced a few regular bulbs and loved them. Bought a bunch more and replaced all our bulbs. Now, only a few months later, bulbs are strobing badly (look it up and read about it as an issue) and have begun to see premature death. Had really high hopes. Starting to regret. Will probably replace over time with different brand and likely much sooner than supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Had them for a month now and they work just fine. Soft white light, rather cold than warm yellowish, but great color rendering. The previous fluorescent bulbs were giving the light beige walls a light purple/pink shade. These led bulbs show the right shade of beige. I installed some with Leviton dimmer switch and some with regular switch. I hope they last!
customer_reviews.author: AdiB

customer_reviews.title: We bought the 8 x 3000 & 4 x 4000 ...
customer_reviews.text: We bought the 8 x 3000 & 4 x 4000 bulbs and they're as advertised. They've only been in use for 2 days so time will tell and I'll update accordingly. UPDATE After a few months one of the eight bulbs now flickers after being on for more than a minute. UPDATE #2 Hyperikon sent out a replacement bulb and it's working well.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs buzz and  flicker  in a dimmer fixture - not really dimmable!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs buzz and it is really annoying. I wish I had read all the comments before I bought the four pack. Apparently when you install them in a fixture with a dimmer they buzz. They also flicker. I am not going to bother returning them as I suppose I can use them in fixtures with no dimmer. But they shouldn't say "dimmable" if they buzz and flicker.
customer_reviews.author: Marleen Lee

customer_reviews.title: Most advanced tech yet!
customer_reviews.text: 3000K is my favorite color temp for home use. Very nice white light with excellent color rendition (index over 90). Puts out more light and less heat than others of same wattage. No smell. These are a big enough improvement over my Costco ones that I want to replace them with these. I read that schools do better with 6000K color temp to keep students awake and learning.
customer_reviews.author: Test-Equip.Tom

customer_reviews.title: Warm yet bright
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lights! They definitely provide a lot of brightness to my room, but they're still decent for make-up, and not yellowish, nor blueish. I have a medusa type of lamp with several heads, so this is the perfect purchase, because the light is right, but it's also not consuming a ton of energy.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs buzz loudly which is super annoying.
customer_reviews.text: These buzz loudly with all my lutron dimmers :-( I was very disappointed. My lutron dimmers clearly state they work with LED's however these bulbs buzz loudly which is super annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Warranty Service!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 3000K bulbs - after buying bulbs from Home Depot, Lowes, Walmart, etc. These bulbs are perfect - not too yellow, not so bright that you need to wear sunglasses. AND BEST OF ALL - THEY HONOR THEIR WARRANTY - without any hassle! I had a kitchen bulb that had been flickering, then stopped working. I called Hyperikon and gave them the Amazon order number covering the bulb purchase, they had my info immediately available and confirmed that they would ship a replacement bulb that same day. Fantastic! All future bulbs for my house will be Hyperikon!
customer_reviews.author: CJK

customer_reviews.title: Started buzzing and blinking within a year.
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the bulbs bulbs started buzzing and blinking before a year's time. I thought these were supposed to last for 45K hours?? A year only has 8.8K years, so it should have lasted at least 4 years of constant use! The white base of the bulb also turned yellow, I believe due to overheating. It's not necessarily due to being enclosed because one of the bulbs was fully exposed to the air in the kitchen's hanging lamp. I was thoroughly unimpressed and will avoid this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Chung

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to integrate with the Echo as it should be ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as easy to integrate with the Echo as it should be - and it's buggy, at best. One of the lights turns itself on and off seemingly at will, I've had to reprogram the "group" several times.... longest I've gone without a problem with the group has been 3.5 days. Not ready for prime time - stricly an "early adopter" item.
customer_reviews.author: SF_Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The customer was very pleased as we cut their lighting bill by 2⁄3 and ...
customer_reviews.text: This order of 4 lamps was for replacements of ones we installed in a condominium complex. Our company retrofitted about 160 fixtures with these lamps. The customer was very pleased as we cut their lighting bill by 2⁄3 and extended the life of the lamps to 3 years instead on 1. We have only replaced 4 that have failed.
customer_reviews.author: George Bavolak

customer_reviews.title: Great light, great price, great useability
customer_reviews.text: I bought 20 of these bulbs for a house remodel I was doing and wanted to put in LEDs for all the lighting fixtures. These went in all the bathroom fixtures and I am amazed at the light output, the great heat reduction even compared to CFLs, the price, and the warranty. I am going to order more for all the chandeliers, ceiling light fixtures, lamps, and outside carriage and post lamps. I will definitely buy these again for the next remodel I am starting in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Chip A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color and light output
customer_reviews.text: Excellent color and light output. They buzz like a bee when in a dimmer though. I wouldn't reccomend them for that purpose. I ended up using them in other fixtures that don't dim. Yes this was with a lutron dimmer for LEDs.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: ... too many options for dimmable LED lights but Im happy with these light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I have not seen too many options for dimmable LED lights but Im happy with these light bulbs. They are nicely sized and fit in our living room chandelier. I also have this in our nursery and it nicely lights up our room with a warm but not too bright light. I have used CFL bulbs in the past and had issues with the CFL bulbs flickering and making noise. This LED bulb is quiet consistent and smooth and its a great price.
customer_reviews.author: jvee82

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a day early, packaging is great, no chance of breakage the way these were packed. I've looked for what seems forever for bulbs that actually are dimmable, and won't blow out after only a few dimming. With the guarantee Hyperikon offers I'm sure I'll return for more bulbs, as needed!
customer_reviews.author: Jar head

customer_reviews.title: Great if you like constant flickering
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these bulbs based on the amount of positive reviews. Installed these bulbs on 3 hanging pendant lights. They flicker when turned on. Absolutely unbearable to keep. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are bight and the color is spot on ...
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are bight and the color is spot on. However, I did notice there is a split second delay from flipping the switch to the bulb actually turning on. This is more pronounced if you mix and match these with other bulbs as these will not turn on at the same time as the other bulbs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great color and brightness, slight buzz
customer_reviews.text: The color of these is great. They dim well, but there is a slight buzz that I find annoying. I don't notice it during the day, but late at night when all is silent, it gets under my skin a bit.
customer_reviews.author: flyingfeline

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Big improvement over the CFL's that I had in the bathroom. Instant on at full brightness, color rendering is better. Need to get a few more of these. Update 5-4-17: I liked the ones I bought earlier so much that I bought another pack. These are the gold standard of LED drop in replacement bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mach

customer_reviews.title: Great bulb --- above the rest of LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased many LED bulbs and these are definitely the best. Nice overall spread of light (not dark behind the bulb like Verbatims or others). Instant on. And it's brighter than other bulbs that say they are "810 lumens". Most reviews rave about how it's better than regular bulbs, but that's an of course. I think this is above all the other LEDs out there!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Best LED bulbs I bought so far.
customer_reviews.text: The 3000K color temp is perfect for bedroom lighting with a dimmer. I'm using the Leviton 6674-P0W dimmer switch which provides enough range to satisfy my needs. I get a faint hum from the bulbs when the dimmer is at 100% but I'm not sure if that is the result of old wiring in my apartment, the dimmer I'm using, or the bulbs themselves.
customer_reviews.author: S. Black

customer_reviews.title: I will be purchasing more of these.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the performance of these bulbs. The 340 degree illumination angle gets plenty of light "down" on things (e.g. for reading) and the CRI 90+ produces a noticeably "whiter" light than you get with the (less expensive, non-corrected) CRI 80 bulb. In my view well worth the higher price.
customer_reviews.author: Dr J A Marquis

customer_reviews.title: HIT OR MISS
customer_reviews.text: Hit or miss on this one. Unless you KNOW EXACTLY WHAT YOU WANT, it get's pricey to figure out which set really is soft white, Warm etc. So, Better to buy local instead of enriching this group with mis-purchases.
customer_reviews.author: SORBEE

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs! The color temperature is about right for ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bulbs! The color temperature is about right for a living room, and they cast light evenly. I also use them for my outside porch lighting, which is controlled by a timer, and they work fine. There is a small, but perceptible delay when they're first turned on, but I don't find that a problem.
customer_reviews.author: D. Woo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great! The 3000k color is perfect in my opinion and the CRI 90 rating makes for excellent color rendition. However, I bought these for a 3-head vanity in my bathroom and the 60w bulbs are a bit too bright. I want to buy multiple 40w bulbs but Amazon only offers them per bulb. :(
customer_reviews.author: S. East

customer_reviews.title: Be better if they were 75 watt equivalent  but they work ok.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why almost ALL LED co's make LED bulbs equal to a 60 watt bulb? WHO actually used 60 watt conventional bulbs around the house, I know I had 75's though my house !! The bulbs are fine and give off a nice white light that isn't blue but I use these at work in a single bulb fan/light combo and it would be better if it was a little bright not blue er !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Dimmable LED Bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased other supposedly "dimmable" LED lightbulbs but they would flicker at anything but the full-on dimmer setting. I replaced them with these Hyperikon LED bulbs that I bought on amazon.com and they work perfectly with the dimmer. I recommend these bulbs and would definitely purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dave-S

customer_reviews.title: Bright and cool future
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs are very bright, the light is crisper than an ordinary bulb and the don't put out any heat. I placed my hand on the bulb while it was on for over an hour. As for the noise I don't hear it but I'm not the best judge for that as I'm I a cochlear implant wearer and I don't hear a lot of things. I would recommend these bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Pierce

customer_reviews.title: These are SUPER bright at their brightest (or it could just be ...
customer_reviews.text: These are SUPER bright at their brightest (or it could just be I've been without quality lighting for a while). I love that they're dimmable, and they appear to be good quality for the price. As others mentioned, I did notice some humming/buzzing, but it is not disruptive or distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie M

customer_reviews.title: Works well in the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 3000k light bulbs for bathroom use. They work great and allow me to see myself clearly in the mirror. I prefer the white light, but people with more sensitive eyes might want to try a lower color temperature as it can be straining.
customer_reviews.author: Vu

customer_reviews.title: Low power bright white lights
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these lights throughout my home and I love the white light that they project. I've been using them in my kitchen for a year and they are still going strong... at least 8 hours a day every day. I haven't tried a dimmer with these bulbs so I can't comment on that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I put these 4 bulbs in main bathroom over vanity, because kids always leaving lights on. They work great. My teenage girls love the brightness and color of them for makeup. Haven't tried with a dimmer yet but plan to get more and try soon. The 3000k is the perfect brightness for us.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: The bulbs are great if you're using them as binary on/off lights but ...
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs are great if you're using them as binary on/off lights but the dimmable feature is less effective. When on a dimmer the bulbs buzz and occasionally flicker. The light temperature is quite glaring if it won't be under a shade.
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying. Very durable and long lasting. Check your dimmer switches though!
customer_reviews.text: These Hyperikon bulbs seem to be standing the test of time. I have 1 other brand of LED bulbs which have gone dead in less than three months. I have since upped my rating to 5 stars for their reliability instead of a 4 star. I wish they could dim to a lower level before turning off but that could be the fact that these are LED's not regular filament bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Darren S. Eiswirth

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Great customer service! I ordered the four pack a few months ago, and only recently got around to leaving a review... one of the bulbs was DOA and so I mentioned this in my previous review. A representative from Hyperikon reached out to me to arrange replacing the malfunctioning bulb... I just installed the replacentment bulb they sent and it works great. Anytime you mass produce something there are going to be duds that slip through Q&A, but I am very impressed that Hyperikon would reach out to me in order to make it right. With customer service like that, I will definitely be purchasing LED bulbs from them in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: Buy these...Instead of the those Cree bulbs !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bulbs. Actually last and don't die like the Cree bulbs I had. These also have a high CRI, which means the colors, light are actual, not modified by the bulb spectrum AND THEY DON'T DIE LIKE THE CREE BULBS...They just keep working, and working and working.....
customer_reviews.author: Redding

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive incandescent replacements.  Great CRI.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced all the CFLs the builder put in my bathrooms with the 3000k version. The light they cast is much better for putting on makeup. Very bright, too. I can see the different colors in my eyes again. I don't know why high CRI LEDs are so hard to find. The CREE TWs were nice, but they are expensive and heavy and now very hard to find. Now to just find quiet dimmables that smoothly get colder (white point temp) as you dim them. I'm not holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Terren

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Work great, just make sure your dimmer switch is led compatible as well. If you have an old dimmer switch with incandescent bulbs you need to replace that switch. Otherwise, it won't matter what dimable led bulbs you buy, they won't work without a proper switch.
customer_reviews.author: S G

customer_reviews.title: Awesome LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Awesome LED bulbs. They are very bright (brighter than 60w incandescent), and 3000k is the sweet spot for color hue as far as I'm conscerned. It's still a soft light, but whiter than the 2700k yellowish incandescent color. They are a great price, and they give off a good omni-directional light, so you don't have blind spots when putting them in fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: DebrodeD

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed these last night in a covered porch enclosed fixture with a photoeye. It's 20° right now and they look just like a regular 60 watt bulb except for color temp. The 3000K color temp is accurate and was exactly what I was looking for. We'll see how they hold up over time, but so far I am VERY pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Electricks

customer_reviews.title: Great Color Temperature - wish they were a bit brighter
customer_reviews.text: I just received these today, and overall I am impressed. The color temperature is very much like daylight, but it does not make the room seem stark or gray like earlier versions of LED bulbs did. I will they were a bit brighter, but they are certainly comparable to 60W bulbs. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: High color index bulbs
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I looked for bulbs like this for a long time. They have the color index at 95! Perfect for people who suffer from eyestrain. I'm switching out all our bulbs to these!
customer_reviews.author: D.  Woodbury

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They've definitely helped us cut back on our electric bill. I do however wish they could dim lower than they have. I believe that has more to do with my outdated dimmer not being able to reduce the electric flow that low. (Super sciency- I know).
customer_reviews.author: S.S.LearTop Contributor: Cooking

product_meta.title: Hyperikon A19 Dimmable LED Light Bulb, 9W (60W Equivalent), Energy Star Qualified, 3000K (Soft White Glow), CRI90+, 820 Lumens, Medium Screw Base (E26), UL-Listed, Standard Light Bulb (4 Pack)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars766 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
